Enjoy the spacious 1st floor of a 3-level house on a quiet leafy street in Huron Village, (West) Cambridge. Sleeps 5. Bedroom 1: queen bed; Bedroom 2: twin bed; Study: pull-out double sofa bed.

Recently renovated with designer furnishings and attention to detail. Breakfast at the kitchen bay window overlooking the garden. No use of rest of house currently

name: Cambridge Getaway @ Harvard & MIT
description:
Charming 2-bedroom apartment on the third floor of our beautiful Victorian home.

The space
This is a charming furnished 2 bedroom apartment with a full bathroom, large eat in kitchen, and a living room. It is on the top floor of a well kept Victorian home. It has a small roof deck where you can enjoy your morning coffee or a glass of wine in the evening. The apartment is located within walking distance of MIT and Harvard. Central and Inman Square are less than 5 minutes away. You can walk to fine dining in Inman square where you will find an eclectic mix of restaurants. Downtown Boston is only a 10 minute train ride away. There you will find shopping areas, world-class hospitals, the convention center, and various museums. Our location is truly in Mid-Cambridge. There is a Whole Foods market and a number of cafes just down the street. Rates are subject to change during the busy season Boston Marathon, local graduations, reunions and the Regatta. Starting 9/1 long-term guests only (3 months or more).

This stylish, contemporary, architect-designed, skylit, tree-top, compact (~700 sq. ft.) apartment can sleep 4: 2 in queen bed + 2 on fold-out floor mattresses in either the 2nd bedroom (which is set up as an office) or the living room alcove. name: Apartment in Harvard's Backyard
description:
The space
Gorgeous apartment in the ideal Cambridge location! It's a spacious and well-laid out one-bedroom - perfect for a couple. It has a nice size living room with incredible sunlight. It's in the tallest building on our street, so from the couch, we see treetops out of all four living room windows! The bedroom has a Queen-size bed, an enormous closet, AC, and 2 windows. Even the bathroom gets sunlight so bright that you feel like you're showering outside! The kitchen is awesome - marble countertops, dishwasher, etc. There are also hardwood floors throughout (minus kitchen and bathroom). There's laundry and bike storage in the basement and a shared yard to boot!

Because we often get asked: we have a Queen-size bed in the bedroom, which is perfect for a couple. When one bed is not enough, we host guests in the living room on our very comfortable West Elm couch, and on our top-of-the-line full size air mattress.

name: East Cambridge Apartment
description:
Our four bedroom home is tucked away in a wonderful neighborhood in East Cambridge. Walk to great neighborhood restaurants and enjoy day trips to Boston with easy access to bus and train lines. Enjoy the backyard and charm of Cambridge.

The space
Location, location, location! It is conveniently located a mile from Harvard Square, steps away from MIT, and a ten minute walk to Charles River and multiple T stops to travel to Boston. This is an 1854 home that has been entirely renovated on the first floor and basement level. Apartment has driveway, a backyard, an updated kitchen, 1 king bed in one bedroom, 2 twins in the bedroom and a bunk bed in the third (2 twins) and a single in the fourth. The apartment is located in Kendall Square and a short walk to many bars and restaurants. Apartment has high ceilings, washer/dryer in kitchen, flat screen tv, and feels far bigger than 2200 sq. feet.

This is a great place for a family or a small group of friends!

name: See Yourself in Central Square
description:
The space
Welcome to our Central Square Apartment, right in the heart of downtown Cambridge! Steps away from the Red Line, we are located right in between Harvard and MIT!

Our Second Floor walk up is a studio apartment with King sized bed, full sized futon couch and sun filled atrium complete with hammock. It has a full bath and a well stocked kitchen. A former seamstress's shop in the seventies, it has floor to ceiling mirrors that gives the space an even larger feel. It still retains some of that funky seventies charm.

Though right in the heart of downtown Cambridge, the apartment is set back from the street so it is surprisingly quiet. An oasis from the city sounds, the apartment shares the 4 story building with office space so evenings are very quiet and private. The Green Street parking garage is located across the street and charges $13 a day. Pearl Street laundromat is two blocks away.

Contemporary, newly renovated 2-bedroom apartment in the heart of Cambridge. Right in Central Sq, and a few blocks from the subway stop. Short walk to Harvard Sq, Kendall Sq/MIT, and the Charles River. Location is very convenient to the major neighborhoods and sites in Boston. Restaurants and shopping all around. Apartment is on a very quiet side street. Amazing kids park on our street. Parking permit included.

The space
Brand new renovation! Beautiful contemporary place in Central Square, Cambridge. 5 minute walk to the red-line subway stop. We are smack-dab in between Harvard Sq and Kendall Sq/MIT. Very spacious, light filled home with a full size dining room. All new furniture - including 2 Queen beds with VERY comfortable memory foam mattresses! Kitchen is equipped with all the cutlery and cookware essential for simple or big family meals. With 2 large bedrooms, a fully stocked kitchen, and a lush living room - you'll feel right at home. This home is close to MIT, Kendall, Central, and Harvard Squares, Boston's Historic Beacon Hill and Downtown, 2 major subways stops and numerous bus routes. An historic gem close to everything Cambridge and Boston have to offer. 3 bedrooms, 3 baths, TV room/study with sleep sofa, mins from all major Cambridge and Boston attractions including the Charles River, Boston Harbor, restaurants, shopping and museums. Off street parking.

The space
This unique property retains many historic features such as original wood shutters, floor to ceiling windows, large pocket doors separating large living and dining rooms with original marble mantels, wide pine floors, and gas fireplaces in living room and TV room. The newly renovated kitchen includes stainless appliances, beautiful large granite island that seats 6, and deck leading out to a courtyard with beautiful gardens, gas grill and large mosaic dining table.

Exquisite garden level (semi basement) room in a Victorian house in Harvard Square/Harvard University. Harvard schools within few minutes of walk. Three blocks to the Harvard Sq. Red line subway train. #1 Bus Stop and Harvard LMA to MIT, Boston, and Longwood Medical Center in front of house. Restaurants of all sorts and shops are within walking distance.

The space
Very safe, bustling with shops, restaurants, Harvard Square live street shows. Charles river nearby, excellent for jugging, biking and walking, etc.

Access to kitchen, relaxing private side and back deck with chairs, tables and shade to read and drink.

description:

name: Quiet 2 Bedroom Apartment near MIT, BU & HBS
description:
Our private 2 bedroom apt. is in an antique home on a quiet street. In addition to the two air-conditioned bedrooms, it has a living room, kitchen/dining room and a full bath. 10 minute walk to Central Square 'T' station, BU bridge, Trader Joe's and Whole Foods. WiFi. Due to recent city short-term rental regulations limiting homeowners to one apartment, we must have guests book our 2 bedroom apartment for 90+ days or longer. Please send a message to discuss making your dates work.

Guest access
After entering an exterior door and walking up on flight of stairs, guests have their own locked entrance to the private apartment. Guests have shared access to the side patio and yards, including a charcoal grill. Washer & dryer available in the cellar. On street parking. Great WiFi, too.

Other things to note
For your convenience, we have an MBTA 'Charlie Card' available. Fares on the reloadable plastic card are cheaper than those on the paper card.

name: Three-bedroom Harvard Square condo.
description:
1400 sf 3.5-bedroom condo two blocks from Harvard Yard. The entire top floor of a three-story house so you get light from all four sides. Seven minutes from the Harvard Square Red Line T station. Perfect set-up for a couple with kids. The downstairs unit, exactly half the size, sold in June 2017 for over $800k.

We use this mostly as an office so everything is set up well for working, including laser printer.

Well-behaved dogs welcome.

Condo docs require that we rent for at least one month.

The space
Although we use it as an office we try to keep it set up as though a family with two kids had just walked out the door. There is a full selection of toys for ages 3-7. There is also some stuff for a dog (we have a Golden Retriever).

Guest access
The whole condo is yours!

name: Prime location Harvard/Porter Sq
description:
Prime location between Harvard/Porter sq. King bed, en suite bathroom, offering good value for two people. Off street family home, quiet yet yards away from all the action. The room is mostly taken up by the bed. There is ample cupboard and drawer space for a longer stay, a wall mounted tv with cable and a white noise machine for sleeping, not that it’s noisy, I just noticed they’ve become popular.

The space
The house is eclectic, furnished with vintage furniture, and maybe a bit of a fixer upper by American standards but most people love it. The bed is quite low so perhaps not suitable for older people. The shower head is new but the bathtub is old, and has a few hard water stains by the tap. The room is not pitch black in the mornings, so some guests may like to bring an eye mask. name: Beautiful home, Short Walk to Harvard
description:
10 minute walk to Harvard, 15 minutes to MIT. Beautiful 1920's apartment with original period details furnished in my comfy, funky style, 2 Bedrooms with queen beds, beautifully renovated kitchen, living room, dining room, sunroom, outdoor patio and garden.

The space
I am only the second owner of this apartment (now a condo) built in 1926. While it still retains the charm of that period--original mouldings, wall sconces, hardwood floors--I've updated the kitchen and bath for the best of both worlds. It's not a fancy home, but very warm and comfy!

Guest access
Guests have access to the entire apartment and yard as described.

+In-unit laundry

name: The NERDpartment in the heart of Cambridge
description:
Our lovely apartment was former worker's housing built during the late 1880s for the labor force nearby the railway to Boston. Located in the heart of East Cambridge, we're 15 minutes walk from MIT/Kendall and Bunker Hill, and 25 minutes walk from Harvard.

With the disappearance of the railways and the rise of high-tech, most of our tenants, including yours truly, have been academics and students of the many universities nearby!

The space
Besides our proximity to Harvard and MIT, and our close proximity to food and culture (1 min to Thai, Chinese, Mexican, restaurants and a European bakery cafe anyone?), and our building being over 140 years old; we're uniquely trying to best offer a space for families visiting schools, academics and professionals a cozy and inviting space to stay during their visit of our city.

name: Spacious Inman Sq Apt mins from MIT/Harvard
description:
This clean, spacious apartment is in an amazing location for exploring the Greater Boston area. Within easy walking distance of Harvard and Central Squares & MBTA, it is steps from two major bus lines and surrounded by an array of great restaurants. Our family has lived here for generations and the decor reflects our Cambridge roots. There is room here for the whole family to relax after a busy day of sightseeing and a fully equipped kitchen if you need a break from eating out.

The space
This apartment is on the first floor of a classic Cambridge triple decker dating from the late 1800s. There is a large eat-in kitchen and living room, two bedrooms, a sitting room and an office. The sitting room can be used as a third bedroom. The vibe is kind of retro - leaning more toward "Grandma's House" than "Luxury Condo."

Guest access
It is easy to get here by car from I90 or 93. Park in the right-hand space next to the fence. On-street parking

name: 800 Square Foot, 2-bed Apt w/ AC, Laundry, Parking
description:
Large 800 square foot (75 square meter) solar powered garden level 2-bedroom apartment in Cambridge with private entrance, central air/heat, walk-in shower, full-size washer and dryer, kitchen, and smart TV with apps.

We offer free off-street parking for 1 car and are in walking distance to Davis Square (red-line subway station, restaurants and bars, shops, bowling, and theater).

The owners live upstairs and are happy to answer any questions during your stay.

The space
The entrance to the apartment is through a fenced in garden. You'll enter through your own door then descend down to your 2 bedroom apartment built new in the spring of 2022.

The main living area includes a leather sofa with chaise, 55 inch HD TV with all of your favorite apps (Hulu, Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc...). There's a table that can accommodate 4 people, or can be used as a work surface. A ceiling fan (and large window) offer opportunities to circulate air.

Beautiful 3BR/1BA on 2nd floor with office in quiet W Cambridge. Two balconies, shared backyard on bike path connecting to Minuteman and Charles ... pet-friendly!

Apartment is on a residential street 1/2 block from Fresh Pond, a tranquil 2.5 mile loop and gardens around Cambridge drinking water reservoir.

Your rental is the entire second floor of a two-family. We, the owners, live downstairs.

We own this unit to share with family when they are in town and we rent on Airbnb when it is empty.

The space
Note this is a real home! There is some chipped paint. There are some scuff marks. A real family lives here! Please do not book if you're looking for a pixel-perfect hip modern soulless Ikea catalog page.

Bedroom 2: One queen with limited dresser space.
Bedroom 3: One twin and small desk.

name: Economy 2 Bed w/ Free Parking in East Cambridge
description:
This is an economy 2 bed, 1 bath with a free parking space available in East Cambridge. This is close to many main destinations including MIT, Kendall Square, Cambridgeside Galleria, and the Charles River.

Unit is in a classic Cambridge home. So it does not have a recently renovated feel. But everything is clean and functional. The unit's best selling point is its central location and that we can provide free parking- a rarity in Cambridge.

2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom. Please pay attention to the photos. There is no dedicated 'living room'.

Other things to note
Parking space is a few blocks away. Only space for one car, no particularly large cars, but a medium SUV or smaller should be fine.

name: Charming Multi-Level Townhouse, Harvard, MIT, MBTA
description:
Location, location, location, charming multi-level townhouse found minutes to Harvard Business School, Red line, and Central Square. Easy access to MIT, Longwood Medical hospitals,  universities, Harvard , Kendall and Inman Sq.

The space
Townhome is found on a quiet residential street featuring 4 levels of living  . This space can be used as a one bedroom with  two living rooms, 1.5 baths and basement or a two bedroom, living room, 1.5 baths and basement.

First floor features a kitchen, dining and living room, second floor bedroom offers  a queen sized bed and full bathroom. Trundle bed with a full and twin size mattress located on the third floor, 50" flat screen Tv and desk. (Please note: must walk thru second floor bedroom to access third floor.) Lower level features a half bath, desk and additional seating area.

On-site rental parking and coin-op laundry.

Guest access
Entire unit, coin-op laundry.

name: 2 Bed w/ Free Parking in East Cambridge
description:
This is a very well located 2 bed apartment with nearby parking (a very rare amenity in the Cambridge/Boston area). You'll be close to MIT, Harvard, the Charles River, as well as several shopping areas and grocery stores that have everything you'd need during your stay.

This is a great place to stay for your trip to Cambridge or Boston area.

Other things to note
We have one parking space available about a 5 min walk away. This is great for short term guests because parking in the Cambridge/Boston area is a challenge for nonresidents. So an off street parking space for visitors is a rare amenity we're able to offer.

The rest of the neighborhood is very walkable with a walk score of 96. You'll be able to walk to all the stores you need on a day to day basis. There is a large grocery store and a Target just a few blocks away.

name: Beautiful & Sunny Home in the heart of Cambridge
description:
You will enjoy easy access to everything in Cambridge and Boston from this sunny and spacious central location. Wonderful restaurants, shops and parks nearby in both Central and Harvard Square. Off street parking for 2 cars and large dining room. very close to Central Square MBTA station. Short walk to Harvard & Central Square and Charles River. Perfect for Harvard graduation week and Boston area cultural events. Fenced back yard has large outdoor grill and stone patio for outdoor dining!

The space
First floor bedroom had a full bed with windows front and back. Spacious Third floor bedroom 1 has a queen size bed and skylight. Spacious Third floor bedroom 2 has single beds. Full baths are located on the first and second floors. Second floor bath has a claw foot tub

Kitchen, backyard, dining room, living room, bedrooms on first and third floors

description:
Located conveniently on Mass Ave in Cambridge, this updated 2b/2b is short walk from Davis Sq through a lovely tree-line bike path. Find all you need in everyday life from restaurants to shops to banks. You can move-in and start your life immediately with ease. Hop on MBTA buses to Harvard right in front of the next building. description:

This private apartment is on the first floor of a two-family house. It features hardwood floors and a 9-foot ceiling throughout the 700-sqft space.

name: Cozy Room. Minutes to Harvard, MIT, MGH, Lesley
description:
Prime location with everything within walking distance or one quick subway ride.

3 mins walk to Porter Square (red line), which leads you to Harvard (8 mins), MIT (14 mins), MGH (20 mins, door to door). 5 mins walk to Lesley University, supermarket, and many cafe/eateries. Spacious room with lots of natural light. Shared dine-in kitchen and bathroom (3 people max) gives you full convenience with enough privacy.

Nearby hotel (Porter Square Hotel) is asking $300/night!

The space

description:
This unique, quiet, and peaceful room in Inman Square is centrally located—a 10-to-15-minute walk to Harvard, MIT, Central Square, and the tech companies around Kendall Square. Whole Foods, Koreana, S&S Deli, local microbreweries, and many more food options are within blocks. This private room shares a bathroom with one other room. Access to the kitchen and deck and also included. An economical “get away” in the heart of Cambridge.

name: Entire basement with private bedroom + bathroom
description:
**SUBLEASE AVAILABLE**

The space
Beautiful, spacious, 1 Bedroom/1 Bathroom apartment located in the heart of Porter Square. This apartment is part of a 3 bedroom apartment, shared with 2 graduate school students.
The entire basement of this apartment is yours. The basement includes a private bedroom, living room, bathroom, mini kitchen/bar, wine cooler, Nespresso machine, working desk, large closet, high-speed WiFi, and all utilities. A full kitchen is located on the 1st floor, and the washer/dryer is located on the 2nd floor. Kitchen utensils included.

The apartment is a 2min walking distance from Porter Square, which includes access to the Red Line, Smart Market, Target, and restaurants. The Red Line has a 15min transit to Downtown Boston from Porter Square. The location is also 1min walk from the Route 77 Bus Stop.

All utilities + Wifi INCLUDED.

Must be a 6-month sublease from March 1st to September 1st.

name: Huron Village House Shared Lower
description:
Must love dogs. Bruno is the big pup in the profile pic. He is a mixed rottweiler/pitbull but looks like a Lab. Guests must be willing to live with him and even help care for him when I travel. Bodie is my brother and his wife’s dog. They live in separate apartments upstairs. The two dogs love to play outside and in when we let them. If you are a dog person and I haven't deterred you, let me tell you more about the apartment. There is much to love about the house, living space, and neighborhood.

The space
They call this house type “Philadelphia style.” The first floor is pretty open with a living room/dining room/kitchen - and the bathroom and my bedroom. The room for rent is up a set of stairs to the single room on the second floor.
It is an old house with some natural charm. The kitchen and bathroom were renovated about six years ago. There are hardwood floors throughout - and great natural light. It is brightly decorated with lots of original eclectic

description:
Beautiful two bedroom apartment on the first floor of a classic two-family home in West Cambridge. A corner lot in a quiet neighborhood, with a grassy yard on three sides and small city garden across the street. A block from Danehy Park, a five minute walk to Huron Village and Fresh Pond Reservation, a twenty minute walk to Porter Square, and a quick bus ride to Harvard Square. A perfect home base for college tours and working vacations. The owners, long time Airbnb travelers, live upstairs.

Spacious but cozy two bedroom apartment with a large living/dining area, eat in kitchen and laundry in the unit. One bedroom has a queen sized bed and the other has been configured as a study, with a queen pull out sofa (we think it's very comfortable!) and desk for working.

Guest access
The shared back yard has a grill, table and chairs for eating, and comfortable seating for entertaining al fresco.

Family-friendly, spacious and central, with comfortable spaces inside and out. *Discounts available for 1-week or longer stays.*

The space
The first floor is open-concept with 2 living rooms in the front and back, and the kitchen and dining room in between. There's a rowing machine in the basement, bikes and scooters for small kids in the outdoor shed, and a full size picnic table in the backyard.
